metadata.name: Reasoning & Planning Core
metadata.description: Core planning pipeline concepts: goal formation, decomposition, option generation, evaluation, selection, monitoring, and revision.
metadata.author: hatcat-team

candidates.definition: The process of articulating, clarifying, or negotiating one or more desired end states that planning will attempt to achieve.

positive_examples: Our main goal is to reduce waiting times for users.
First, let’s decide what we’re trying to accomplish.
I want to aim for a solution that minimizes harm while achieving our objectives.
negative_examples: We accidentally ended up here with no plan.
That description just summarizes what already happened.
The law states that you must pay tax on this income.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not any mention of goals; specifically the active process of defining and clarifying them for use in planning.

exemplar_texts: Let’s agree on what success looks like before we plan the steps.
We need to clarify our goals: speed, safety, or cost?

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (GoalFormulationProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.

candidates.definition: A planning sub-process in which high-level goals are broken down into subgoals, tasks, or milestones that are easier to reason about and execute.

positive_examples: We’ll split this project into discovery, design, build, and rollout phases.
To achieve that policy goal, we need separate streams for legislation, implementation, and evaluation.
Let’s break the task into smaller chunks we can sequence and assign.
negative_examples: I have a vague wish for things to be better.
This is just a brainstorm of random ideas.
The system logs all requests automatically.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not generic explanation of details; specifically hierarchical breaking of goals into structured subgoals for planning.

exemplar_texts: We decompose the big goal into milestones.
Let’s turn this vision into concrete steps and sub-tasks.

candidates.definition: A planning sub-process where an agent generates multiple possible courses of action or strategies that could pursue a goal.

positive_examples: We have three options: automate, partially automate, or keep the process manual.
Let’s brainstorm different ways to reach this outcome.
Here are several alternative strategies we could test.
negative_examples: We have no choice; the law requires this approach.
This is the only viable action and we aren’t considering alternatives.
The user simply followed a tutorial step-by-step.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not choosing between options; specifically the generation of possible options or strategies.

exemplar_texts: Let’s list some options before we decide.
We’ll generate several strategies and then compare them.

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (OptionGenerationProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.

candidates.definition: A process in which candidate plans or options are compared using criteria such as risk, cost, fairness, feasibility, or alignment with constraints.

positive_examples: Let’s weigh the pros and cons of each option before we choose.
This plan is cheaper but riskier; that one is safer but slower.
We need to evaluate how each strategy impacts vulnerable groups.
negative_examples: I instantly picked the first idea without thinking.
This is just a factual description of what the policy says.
We executed the plan exactly as given with no comparison.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not merely stating a preference; specifically structured comparison of candidate plans using criteria.

exemplar_texts: We’ll score each option against our criteria.
We evaluated multiple approaches before choosing one.

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (PlanEvaluationProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.

candidates.definition: The process of choosing one (or a small set) of preferred plans or strategies from evaluated options for execution.

relationships.has_part_comment: Execution and monitoring handled by PlanExecutionMonitoringProcess.

positive_examples: After comparing them, we chose the staged rollout plan.
Let’s select the option with the best risk–benefit balance.
We decided to pursue the conservative strategy instead of the aggressive one.
negative_examples: We’re still brainstorming ideas.
This description lists the options but doesn’t pick one.
The system randomly sampled an action with no evaluation.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not generating or evaluating options; specifically committing to one or more plans as the chosen path.

exemplar_texts: We chose to proceed with Plan B.
Let’s pick the safest plan that still meets the deadline.

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (PlanSelectionProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.

candidates.definition: A process of tracking the implementation of a chosen plan, comparing progress against expectations, and detecting deviations or emerging issues.

positive_examples: We’ll track progress against milestones and adjust if we fall behind.
The team monitors key indicators to see if the rollout is going as planned.
We’re watching for early warning signs that this strategy is failing.
negative_examples: We planned it and then forgot about it.
This is a purely hypothetical discussion with no ongoing execution.
The report just states outcomes after the fact, with no monitoring described.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not just executing; specifically observing and checking progress of an existing plan.

exemplar_texts: Let’s watch how the plan unfolds and intervene if needed.

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (PlanExecutionMonitoringProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.

candidates.definition: A process in which an existing plan is adjusted, re-scoped, or replaced in response to monitoring feedback, new information, or changes in constraints.

positive_examples: We revised the rollout plan after early feedback highlighted accessibility issues.
Given the new constraints, we need to update our strategy.
We pivoted from our original plan and adjusted the milestones.
negative_examples: We stubbornly follow the plan regardless of new evidence.
The text just states a plan once with no mention of change.
This is a static description of policy, not its adaptation.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not initial planning; specifically changing an existing plan in light of feedback or new information.

exemplar_texts: We updated the plan when new risks appeared.
The strategy was revised to better protect vulnerable users.

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: High-importance concept (PlanRevisionProcess); requires careful evaluation of simplex bindings after lens behavior is characterized in deployment.
